intro: Nonea flavescens, commonly known as the yellow sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. It produces small, wind-dispersed seeds that aid in its propagation across open landscapes. Nonea flavescens is often found in desert scrub and creosote bush communities.
